intro: Maughania strobilifera, commonly known as the Mexican mountain cedar, is a deciduous tree native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Cupressaceae family and is characterized by its scale-like leaves and woody cones. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in temperate to subtropical climates. Its bark is thick and fissured, providing protection against environmental stressors. Maughania strobilifera plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, offering shelter and food for various wildlife species.
